attributes.action: Allow A-Level and GCSE students the option to take their predicted grades
attributes.additional_details: With the uncertainty of schools staying open, the cancellations of revision sessions (such as the tutor2u Psychology booster) and fears over COVID-19, many students are struggling to effectively revise. I am asking the UK government to make it an option for those who would prefer it to take their predicted grades or a grade based on coursework and current predicted grades (allowing for grades to improve), reducing stress and the need for unwarranted gatherings.
attributes.background: Those taking their A-Levels and GCSE examinations this summer should be given the option to be graded in another way, including coursework, predicted grades and past examinations

rejection.details:
Decisions about exams are a matter for exam boards and individual schools, and are not a matter for the UK Government or Parliament.

You can find out more about coronavirus and how you can protect yourself and others here:
NHS website: https://www.nhs.uk/conditions/coronavirus-covid-19/
UK Government website: https://www.gov.uk/guidance/coronavirus-covid-19-information-for-the-public
